page.title: 06FARMING: CROPS
page.content: The farms in this area are fairly small. There are parts of 15 farms in this block (though only parts of one or two fields in some cases). Most of the block is shared by eight farms. The farmland is mainly arable, with cereals predominant. A{Little Bytham farm (not entirely within this block) has 319 acres of wheat (appropriately named Norman and Longbow), 54 winter barley, 8 spring barley, 20 oilseed rape and 11 acres of grass. A{Careby}farm has 57 acres of winter barley, 31 oilseed rape, 30 of field beans, 64 spring wheat for bread- making, 140 winter wheat (some for bread and some for feed), a 3 acre grass paddock and 3 acres devoted to a nursery for garden plants. Small quantities of potatoes, maize, sugar beet and kale are grown in the area. Another nursery covers 10 acres.
